comments.body:
@Huang-Wei what are your thoughts on this?

Another option is to create folder within `plugins/volumebinding` which is completely owned by sig storage, but the parent folder is still owned by sig-scheduling. But perhaps that's overkill.

Probably overkill if the only benefit is to enforce separating the responsibility of reviewing/ownership. In practice, we usually request cofyc or msau42 to take a look if we're not 100% sure of changes in this folder, which works great so far :)

It is still not clear for me. We need remove this file to return ownership to sig-scheduling or we need to do something like this:
```
approvers:
- sig-scheduling-maintainers
reviewers:
- sig-scheduling
- cofyc
- msau42
- lichuqiang
```
(leave original reviewers 
https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/9ff3b7e744b34c099c1405d9add192adbef0b6b1/pkg/controller/volume/scheduling/OWNERS)

WDYT @Huang-Wei ?
You can leave it like this

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1,5 @@# See the OWNERS docs at https://go.k8s.io/owners

approvers:
- sig-storage-approvers
- cofyc
